meanings.definition: Siddurim: plural form of siddur, a Jewish prayer book
meanings.sent1: During the service, the rabbi handed out siddurim to everyone.
meanings.sent2: The synagogue had a shelf full of siddurim for the congregation to use.
meanings.sent3: As the siddurim piled up, it looked like a colorful tower of prayers.
meanings.sent4: The siddurim were a bridge connecting the worshippers to their faith.
meanings.sent5: The worn-out siddurim whispered stories of generations past.

meanings.definition: Siddurim: used as a noun to refer to multiple prayer books in Hebrew
meanings.sent1: In Hebrew class, the students studied the meanings of different siddurim.
meanings.sent2: The library had a section dedicated to siddurim in various languages.
meanings.sent3: The siddurim on the shelf chatted quietly about their favorite prayers.
meanings.sent4: The siddurim in the room hummed with ancient wisdom and modern hope.
meanings.sent5: The colorful covers of the siddurim brightened the room with faith.
